intro: Brackenridgea mindanaensis, commonly known as Mindanao brackenridgea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palm-like leaves that are divided into segments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Brackenridgea mindanaensis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests.
